utterance.speaker: Donald
utterance.content: How about the name Brooke?

utterance.speaker: Sarah
utterance.content: She just doesn't seem like a Brooke anymore.

utterance.speaker: Donald
utterance.content: Brook Lynn.

utterance.speaker: Sarah
utterance.content: She's a baby, not a city.

utterance.speaker: Donald
utterance.content: What do you think, bud? Got any suggestions?

utterance.speaker: Walker
utterance.content: Toadette. I'm hungry.

utterance.speaker: Donald
utterance.content: I'll get you guys something to eat. You're okay. Okay.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: I was paged? What are you doing here?

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Can we talk somewhere?

utterance.speaker: Donald
utterance.content: I was thinking Doroth — Sarah?

utterance.speaker: Sarah
utterance.content: Um. Yeah.

utterance.speaker: Donald
utterance.content: Where's the baby?

utterance.speaker: Voice on Walkie Talkie
utterance.content: Attention all units…

utterance.speaker: Smits
utterance.content: No one saw anyone go in or out, and the baby's not in the nursery.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: What was her condition?

utterance.speaker: Maldonado
utterance.content: Five weeks preterm. C-section because her mom's preeclampsia.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Is that the father? Mr. Lozinski. I'm Dr. Lisa Cuddy, Dean of Medicine. How long were you out of the room?

utterance.speaker: Donald
utterance.content: Um, 15, 20 minutes tops.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Was there a proximity alarm?

utterance.speaker: Smits
utterance.content: No alarms.

utterance.speaker: Donald
utterance.content: What's that?

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: The bracelet on your baby's ankle has a microchip that would set off alarms if she was carried through an exit. Call the police. Shut down all the exits. We are on lockdown. Nobody moves until we find that baby.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Why won't you sign the divorce papers?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: It's been on my to-do list. Sorry.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Will you sign them?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Not until we have a real conversation about our marriage.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Okay. I made a mistake coming here. I'm sorry. I'm gonna leave... this copy here.

utterance.speaker: Loud Speaker
utterance.content: Code seven. Code seven. All non-essential personnel and guests please remain where you are. Security personnel should report to their staging areas and await further instructions. All patients, please remain in your rooms, and use call buttons if you need medical assistance. Please remain calm and wait for hospital personnel to come to you. Do not try to leave your room until the code seven has been lifted. Please clear hallways.

utterance.speaker: Guard
utterance.content: Nurse, just leave it. Leave it. You need to get into the room now.

utterance.speaker: Loud Speaker
utterance.content: Please notify hospital personnel or police immediately if you see anything suspicious.

utterance.speaker: Loud Speaker
utterance.content: We cannot allow anyone to leave the hospital at this time. All personnel should remain in their staging areas unless otherwise instructed by security.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Yeah, yeah, yeah, gotta clear the —

utterance.speaker: Loud Speaker
utterance.content: Thank you for your patience and cooperation.

utterance.speaker: Another Guard
utterance.content: And did anyone other than your nurses ever come by asking about your daughter?

utterance.speaker: Sarah
utterance.content: No. No, just those two.

utterance.speaker: Another Guard
utterance.content: I'll check in soon.

utterance.speaker: Sarah
utterance.content: Wait.

utterance.speaker: Donald
utterance.content: What are you doing?

utterance.speaker: Sarah
utterance.content: No, I need to help them look. Ow!

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: You have to stay in bed. You pulled a stitch. Lay back down. I got it. Why don't I give you something to help you relax?

utterance.speaker: Sarah
utterance.content: No, no, I don't want to relax. I want to find my baby.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: The police are searching room by room.

utterance.speaker: Sarah
utterance.content: Who would take her? What if she needs to be fed?

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: We're gonna find her.

utterance.speaker: Donald
utterance.content: Why aren't the police talking to our nurse?

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: What now?

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Truth or dare?

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Oh, no, you don't want to mess with me. True or dare queen at Newton North.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: I was kidding. I'm sure we can find something interesting to talk about without relying on some juvenile game.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Sure.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Truth.

utterance.speaker: Smits
utterance.content: They think I took the kid? Do you think I would do something —

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: No, I'm just asking questions.

utterance.speaker: Smits
utterance.content: The dad let the older brother hold the baby for the first time. So I put her in his lap. After a few seconds, she shrieked. I'm pretty sure he pinched her.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: I need to know this stuff. Anything out of the ordinary.

utterance.speaker: Smits
utterance.content: It was sibling rivalry. I thought it was kind of ordinary.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: What are you doing down here?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: I was looking for McKenna's patient file.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Oh, you mean this file? The one I said I'd get?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Two hours ago?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Seriously, you don't trust me with the immense responsibility of fetching a file?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: If you already found it, what are you looking through those for?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Do you know what these are? The staff credentials files.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Those should all be in H.R.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Down here to be digitized. And we're locked in, and whoever's supposed to be watching 'em is locked out. We could look up anything on anyone. Malpractice records, felony histories —

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Put them away.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Come on. We have a tiny window of opportunity to gain some insight into our colleagues. Okay. What if we just snoop on the boss?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: I think I can live with that.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You're on two milligrams of morphine an hour. How the hell are you still awake? No, don't tell me. Ischemic cardiomyopathy. If the blood's not reaching your gut, you have intestinal hypoperfusion. That'd be stronger than the narcotics.

utterance.speaker: Nash
utterance.content: The nurse said I might only have a day or two left.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: She was being kind.

utterance.speaker: Nash
utterance.content: You're Dr. House, aren't you?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Oh, God, don't tell me we used to date.

utterance.speaker: Nash
utterance.content: The limp. Yeah, I read about you. I sent you a letter before they knew what was wrong. Tried to get you to take my case.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Yeah, well, you should have kept reading. Heart disease is kind of below my pay grade.

utterance.speaker: Nash
utterance.content: It started as tooth pain. No one got it that it was a heart problem. Till I had a series of massive heart attack —

utterance.speaker: Nash
utterance.content: This doesn't bother you?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You talking with your mouth full? A little.

utterance.speaker: Nash
utterance.content: I meant the fact that you're standing here watching me die because of my – my file bored you.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I take maybe 1 in 20 cases. A lot of the people I turn down end up dying. It's really a good argument for there being more than one me when you think about it.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Truth.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: All right. Have you ever had a threesome?

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: You haven't?

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Wait, just – just because I'm bisexual?

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Well, yeah.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Do you understand what bisexual means? It doesn't mean you have sex with two people at once. And by the way, you didn't ask me if I'd had a foursome. Truth or dare?

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Wait. You've had a foursome?

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: No, but now you've asked me two questions, so I get to ask you two. You see why I was the queen.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Oh!

utterance.speaker: Sarah
utterance.content: Walker wouldn't do anything. He's my son too.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: I don't mean to sound cold, but he's your stepson. We can't ignore any possibility.

utterance.speaker: Sarah
utterance.content: Walker's been getting in fights a lot at school lately. Last week, he hit another kid with a book hard enough to draw blood. If he did something to the baby...

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: We were working on it.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: And we failed.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: No, you had a conversation with House, then came back, informed me I'd been forever poisoned by him, and started packing.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: It's interesting how your story leaves out the part where you murdered another human being.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: A dictator who was committing genocide. You thought about doing it yourself.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: But I didn't.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Right. Because you're not toxic like I am.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: What do you think is gonna happen here? You're gonna logic me into coming back?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: There must be over 30 malpractice settlements in here.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: He did a brain biopsy without CT mapping, causing brain herniation and death.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Look at this one. Patient lost four liters of blood from a botched penisectomy.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: On a patient named Lisa Cuddy? Damn it. They're all named Lisa Cuddy.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: He's not even here, and he's screwing with us. Where's the joy in that?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: You really want to get into his head?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Yeah, but I decided against stabbing myself in the leg or getting addicted to pain pills.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: You can, uh... skip the stabbing.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Where did you —

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Confiscated them from a drug seeker in that clinic. Didn't get a chance to turn 'em in.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: It is after hours. I'll take one. Walk in House's shoes for a night.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: One? I believe he wears a larger size.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: No cards, no flowers, not even a phone call. Let me guess. Lighthouse keeper.

utterance.speaker: Nash
utterance.content: I was a classics professor at Princeton for 26 years. Mostly research.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: So your closest colleagues died 2,000 years ago. That must be it. Not that you have no friends because, say, you're a miserable bastard.

utterance.speaker: Nash
utterance.content: What do you care?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: The next few hours are gonna be grim. There'll be nausea, pain, no company, as soon as I can get myself out of here. I can unlock the regulator. You can put yourself in a narcotic haze, sleep blissfully to the end.

utterance.speaker: Nash
utterance.content: Oh, is that a favor to me or to you?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Win-win.

utterance.speaker: Nash
utterance.content: No, thanks.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Are you trying to guilt me for not taking your case?

utterance.speaker: Nash
utterance.content: You think a classicist doesn't believe in fate?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You think Odysseus would lie whimpering like a loser in a hospital bed? Come on, take my offer. Take the drug holiday. Numb yourself out.

utterance.speaker: Nash
utterance.content: I think you're the one who wants to numb himself out.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Truth.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: How did your dad react when you came out to him?

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: He made me tea. Seriously. Doesn't matter what I tell him. He smiles, tells me he supports me, and makes me some peppermint tea. Truth or dare?

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Um, truth.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Are you dating anyone?

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Now? No.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Interesting. You added a modifier. Truth.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Um, when you were dating Foreman...

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: No, no. No.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: If it was something personal about him or us, I just don't think that's right to answer. We all work together.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: That's the whole point of this game — something personal, preferably embarrassing.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Just pick something else.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: You see, this is your problem. You act like you're so liberal and open, but you are the least —

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: I changed my mind. Dare. Just no nudity.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Yes, nudity. I want you to show… your breasts… to Taub.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: That is the most idiotic dare ever. Have you ever played this game?

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Well, I thought showing me your breasts would be a little exploitative.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Your dare is in the future, genius.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Hey, if you're saying you won't do it...

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: No, no, no, no. Of course I'll show my breasts to Taub. Tomorrow, perhaps, or maybe some time next year, you know, because I'm honor-bound. Truth or dare?

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: It's understandable that you wouldn't be happy right now. Your world is changing. You scared? And how do you feel about your sister?

utterance.speaker: Walker
utterance.content: I hate her.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Walker, this is important. Did you do anything to the baby? Did you move her somewhere? Hide her?

utterance.speaker: Walker
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Nobody'd be mad at you.

utterance.speaker: Walker
utterance.content: I said no, so stop asking me.

utterance.speaker: Nash
utterance.content: Bad pain day?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Bad pain month.

utterance.speaker: Nash
utterance.content: Since I'm not using it... Oh, if you don't want the morphine, you must have something of your own, Hmm?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I was in rehab. I had a little problem with the something of my own. Now all I take is ibuprofen, and it's two flights up.

utterance.speaker: Nash
utterance.content: For the whole month?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: The pain's migrated. I think the arterial wall is damaged.

utterance.speaker: Nash
utterance.content: What, you don't know?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I haven't had an arteriogram yet.

utterance.speaker: Nash
utterance.content: And you don't want the test. In case the arterial wall is fine. Which would mean that the pain is coming from something else. What's her name?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Interesting... That you jump from physical pain to long-lost love. You're projecting. So what's her name?

utterance.speaker: Nash
utterance.content: What time is it?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: What does it matter to you? It's "t" minus four hours. 8:20. Now tell me who she is and what are the pathetically long odds that she's gonna visit or call. And why that's a reason not to take the morphine.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Dude.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Dude.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Is the room still spinning?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Mine is. Maybe we shouldn't have taken so many.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: I'm gonna try to stand up.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: You be careful.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Oh, yeah. That's working.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: I can't feel my face.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: No way.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Way. Hit me.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Hit me in the face.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Seriously?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: You know you've always wanted to. Now's your chance.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: That's a great idea. We start a fight club. Maybe we... Oh, my God! You — that is so cool!

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: I can still feel my hand.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: I wasn't ready.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: What were you gonna do? Flex your goatee muscles? Wait a minute. This is your credentials file?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Hey, give me that.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: That's why you came down here. Not for the patient file. You wanted... You wanted...

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Okay, Robert. I will answer whatever questions you want. But then you're gonna have to sign the papers.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Did you ever love me?

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: How can you even ask that?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: The first time you slept with me was because you were on crystal meth.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: I was on the drugs because I was emotional. It was the emotions that led to the sex, not the drugs.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Not true. After that, you refused to let it go further than just sex.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Because I knew I was falling for you and I didn't want to.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: And that never changed. You broke off our vacation because I bought you a ring.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: I got cold feet. I'm not proud.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: And then you almost called off our wedding because —

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Don’t

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: — you couldn't give up the idea —

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Don’t!

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: — of having your dead husband's baby.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Don't bring him up!

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Because even then, you weren't sure about me. Maybe if I was dying when you married me, it would have been a bit different.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: That's not fair.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: It's not only fair, it's exactly the point. He was dying when you met him, and he was gone just a year into the marriage. So it was all a honeymoon with him. And I could never match up to that. The first time reality intruded —

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Stop this.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Just tell me the truth.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: About what?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Did you ever love me?

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: I don't know!

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Thank you for finally telling me.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Truth.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: You said you weren't dating anyone now. Does that you mean you recently were, or soon will be? Oh. Look who's guarded now. You had no problem talking about your sex life, but your love life... Fine. Dare it is.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: No nudity now or in the future.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: You're too much of a nice boy, Wilson. Let's let the bad boy out for a bit. You have to go steal one dollar right now.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: From who? Oh, come on.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Uh, interned at Hopkins. Old news. Here we go. Academic probation.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: I am asking you to please stop reading.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: I'm afraid I can't do that. Faked a lab result. Very wrong! And you came down to destroy the record before it gets digitized. Permanentized. Even wronger.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: I... I needed to beat all those elite, spoiled kids around me, to show no weaknesses, to win at everything. Why'd I just tell you that? I always talk too much when I'm stoned. Why'd I just tell you that?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: It was stupid. You had great grades. One lab result shouldn't have mattered.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Except I didn't think I deserved to be at a top med school in the first place. Again.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Faking lab results is one thing. But you needing to come down here to destroy the records 12 years after the fact... This isn't about med school. You don't think you belong here. At the hospital.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Dr. Taub, comma, Christopher Michael.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: So this is what it comes down to in the final hours. Deifying some lost love. Hoping to get her on the phone and make everything perfect. It's pathetic. Either you left her for a reason or she left you for a reason. A phone call is not —

utterance.speaker: Nash
utterance.content: It's my daughter.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: So why isn't she here?

utterance.speaker: Nash
utterance.content: I left my family... when Gracie was six. I was sort of forced out, actually, after I'd had an affair with a student.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: For sex or love?

utterance.speaker: Nash
utterance.content: Neither. I'd only married Gracie's mother because of the baby. But I didn't think I could handle commitment, and, like any decent academic, I proved myself right.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: And what time it is matters because?

utterance.speaker: Nash
utterance.content: She's a dance teacher in Atlanta. She gets home from work at 9:00, and I just wanted to speak to her one more time. That's my story. What's yours?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Same thing. Pretty much.

utterance.speaker: Nash
utterance.content: I'm gonna be dead in a few hours. Your secrets couldn't be safer. Unless you're keeping them from yourself.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I like being alone. At least I convince myself that I'm better off that way. And then I met someone… at a psychiatric hospital, of all places. She changed me. And then she left. We're better off alone. We suffer alone. We die alone. Doesn't matter if you're a model husband or father of the year. Tomorrow will be the same for you.

utterance.speaker: Nash
utterance.content: But yesterday would have been different.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Hey, Dar-Daria.

utterance.speaker: Daria
utterance.content: Dr. Wilson.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Could you cook me up a chicken sandwich?

utterance.speaker: Daria
utterance.content: Grill's closed.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: It's important medically. Dr. Hadley needs a high-protein meal right now. She doesn't like to talk about it, but she has hypoproteinemia.

utterance.speaker: Daria
utterance.content: We got chicken salad.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Yeah. That's cold.

utterance.speaker: Daria
utterance.content: She needs to eat warm protein for this disease?

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Well, we could give her cold protein whose uptake enzymes haven't been activated, as long as you don't mind her risking liver and kidney failure and eventual death. But, hey, it's worth it so you don't have to flip on the grill.

utterance.speaker: Daria
utterance.content: You don't have to be obnoxious about it.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: How do you look so okay?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: I spent months wondering how I made it go bad. If you never loved me, then – then I didn't do anything wrong. Hey. Allison, come on. It's all right.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: I still don't know why I said that. It's not even true. I did love you. Just... not in a way that would have ever worked.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Why not?

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Because everything you said is true. I'm a mess. I married a man I knew was dying. So God knows how screwed up I already was. Him dying messed me up even more. I pushed you out of my life. And I-I'm unfixable. Not you.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: I'm sorry.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: I'm sorry too.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Truth.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Shut up.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: I'm sorry.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: It's not your fault.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: No, I didn't even play fair. You asked me how my dad reacted when I told him I was bisexual. And the Huntington's.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: No tea party?

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: I never told him. He's been through enough.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: So he just visits his heterosexual, healthy daughter, and you go out to dinner and a movie and talk about your garden?

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: I work late. He's staying at my house. It's easier if I stay elsewhere as much as I can.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: You can't suppress your life for his convenience.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: You don't see a little irony in that? That's exactly what you do for House. When he moved in with you, you bought a bigger place for him. No wonder you're not dating anyone.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: You're right. That woman, the woman I'm not involved with, her name is Sam Carr. But in 1990 and 1991, it was Sam Wilson.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Your ex-wife?

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: No, my mother. Yes, my ex-wife. Ex number one. She friended me a few weeks ago. We started emailing. It turns out she's recently divorced, and I wanted to ask her out.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: You can't take a woman to dinner, or else House will go running straight back to the loony bin? You're not worried about House. You're worried about yourself. Because she's an ex. So even dinner will mean it's immediately serious.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: What are your favorite parts that you remember?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: I liked how I would wake up in the middle of the night, you'd put your arm around me, and you wouldn't even wake up. I liked watching you stand up to your dad at Christmas when he yelled at your mom. How you didn't even know you were strong. But you were. What do you miss?

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: I miss a lot. But when I think about missing you, I think about that dance class that we took for the wedding. It's weird. I think, he's never gonna hold me like that again.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Oh, God.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: I'm gonna miss this too.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Published in The New England Journal at 26?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Finished all the lab work a year earlier.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Led a group of surgeons to fix cleft palates in Bangladesh?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: What can I say? That concert was very moving to me. I have to take a knee.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: I don't get it. This has got to be the most spectacular file down here. Why are you pretending to be ashamed?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: I would trade mine for yours in a second. When I was in med school, I thought I'd be House some day. Instead, I am a fellow working with – working for people years younger than me.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: So… We both have a few regrets.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: You should be proud of yours. Your life's been trending up.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: No news. How you holding up? You let them sedate you?

utterance.speaker: Sarah
utterance.content: Yeah. Do you have kids?

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: A little girl. I adopted her last year.

utterance.speaker: Sarah
utterance.content: I adopted Walker right after Donald and I got married. What if I can never love Walker the way I love my daughter? Does that make me a horrible person?

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Let me get you some tissues. Did you request some extra towels?

utterance.speaker: Sarah
utterance.content: No. What — why?

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: There are eight towels in Sarah's room.

utterance.speaker: Maldonado
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: There should only be four.

utterance.speaker: Smits
utterance.content: Housekeeping handles towels.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: I need you to track down their logs, figure out who was up there and when.

utterance.speaker: Smits
utterance.content: Because they got extra towels?

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Just find the logs. Now. Adrienne, you okay?

utterance.speaker: Maldonado
utterance.content: Sure.

utterance.speaker: Smits
utterance.content: What's wrong?

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Adrienne, give me your arm. The hair on her left arm is standing up. Asymmetric neurological function. She's having a pilomotor seizure.

utterance.speaker: Smits
utterance.content: She seemed fine a minute ago.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: She was. She's probably been having complex seizures all day. She would be basically functional, but more or less acting on autopilot. She probably dropped the towels off twice. She could have taken the baby.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: We never really did have a proper good-bye.

utterance.speaker: Nash
utterance.content: I guess she's running late.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You don't seem that surprised. That's what you expected to get. You waited until you knew she'd be out.

utterance.speaker: Nash
utterance.content: Her aunt said that she starts work late. Every now and then, I just call to hear her voice on the machine. I was never there when she needed me, so... What right do I have to need her now?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: None. Just means you're a hypocrite. 'Cause apparently you do. Forget about rights. Just tell her what you need to tell her.

utterance.speaker: Nash
utterance.content: Gracie... This is... your father. I love you.

utterance.speaker: Smits
utterance.content: Anything? We've covered every room on Maldonado's logs. Been everywhere she's been.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Where's the other cart? Isn't there usually another cart in here?

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Hey. Okay. Okay. Hi. Oh.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: I should go.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: I just asked Sam to dinner.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Little baby's all growed up.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: You gonna tell your dad?

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: I'll stop by his hotel, talk to him.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Hotel? You said he was staying at your apartment. Was there any truth in anything you said?

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: The part about it being a good idea for you to call Sam. That was true.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Good night, Remy.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Good night, James.

utterance.speaker: Loud Speaker
utterance.content: Code seven has been lifted. Repeat, code seven has been lifted.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: You want your file?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Nah.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Good for you.

utterance.speaker: Loud Speaker
utterance.content: All hospital personnel may leave their staging areas and report back to their departments. Thank you for your cooperation.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: We don't have to tell anybody what we —

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: mm-mm. You got the patient file?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: I'll grab it.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Thanks. See you tomorrow.

utterance.speaker: Nash
utterance.content: I think I'm ready to take you up on your offer.

utterance.speaker: Guard
utterance.content: Dr. House? Lockdown ended a few minutes ago.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Yeah. I know. I'm sorry I didn't take your case.

utterance.speaker: Nash
utterance.content: Me too. Gracie... was the cutest six-year-old you ever saw.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Interesting night, huh? Interesting night.
